The Voices of Tomorrow

Future leaders learn to balance society's needs and the interests of the international community at the biggest forum that emulates The United Nations.

The Epicenter

One of the fastest growing cities in India with a historic confluence of European and traditional culture, the 'Queen of the Arabian Sea' is the epicenter of everything in Kerala.

Where the Bigwigs Meet

Situated at the heart of the hustle and bustle of Kochi, Gokulam Park is a towering symbol of excellence and regularly hosts the who's-who of South India.

DISARMAMENT AND INTERNATIONAL SECURITY

It considers all disarmament and international security matters within the scope of the Charter or relating to the powers and functions of any other organ of the United Nations; the general principles of cooperation in the maintenance of international peace and security, as well as principles governing disarmament and the regulation of armaments; promotion of cooperative arrangements and measures aimed at strengthening stability through lower levels of armaments.

SPECIAL POLITICAL AND DECOLONIZATION COMMITTEE

Initially, the SPECPOL committee was mandated to tackle issues relating to decolonization after World War II. However when most colonies had gained independence by 1990, “Special political” responsibilities were given to it. Together, special political and decolonization issues address a variety of topics including refugees, human rights, peacekeeping, mine action, outer space and more.

UNITED NATIONS SECURITY COUNCIL

The Security Council takes the lead in determining the existence of a threat to the peace or act of aggression. It calls upon the parties to a dispute to settle it by peaceful means and recommends methods of adjustment or terms of settlement. In some cases, the Security Council can resort to imposing sanctions or even authorize the use of force to maintain or restore international peace and security.

ABOUT US

Achieving world peace isn't a piece of cake but we need to start somewhere and the youth is our best bet yet.

The world will always need leaders and we at Govt. Model Engineering College, Kochi, Kerala, believe that leadership is inspired by exposure to problems, ideas, situations and perspectives. With a long standing innovation culture and a drive to serve society, the college, its students and alumni have made an impact on all walks of life.

Continued excellence in technology based education has lead to a collective thought about how to utilize these skills and knowledge for the betterment of the world at large. And thus, the seed for MECMUN was planted. Through the Model United Nations, the college strives to initiate dialogue on complex geo-political issues, that may tilt the balance of the world, and the needs of the people, battling for their rights to voice their thought.

Through the art of diplomacy and the need for artistry in substantial inquisition, the MECMUN will empower delegates to voice their thoughts on a better tomorrow and will challenge them to think critically about the working of the world.
